result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Alvin Markfort was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Alvin Markfort

records.addlTxt: Final notice sent, due 10-26-17. cah
Final notice sent, due 9-28-17. cah
Final notice sent, due 9-28-17. cah

DE called re: Reminder Notice rec'd.  DE stated he had forgotten about his pymt & made it a couple days ago.  DE was advised that his pymt was rec'd & his next pymt is due 7-15-17 & he may disregard the notice.  Includes 13CT319, 15CM212, 16CT53. jaf
Final notice sent, due 6-29-17. cah

From DE stating he has Q's about his Pymt Plan.  Ret'd call to DE & advised him he was sent a copy to the Jail and the home address on file.  DE stated he has a PO Box and confirmed the physical address on his FA file.  DE was also advised that he has a $50 pymt due starting today & on the 15th of ea mo, all cases are merged onto 1 Pymt Plan, & was given the PLC # & case #.  DE is approved to make his pymt tonight to be receipted tomrw.  DE also advised to submit a change of address on his Pymt Plan cases as the court will not automatically update them when he is in for FA hearings, etc.  Includes 13CT319, 15CM212, 16CT53. jaf

Order for payment on May 17, 2017 at 08:45 am.
DE mailed copy this date. jaf

**DE was sent a copy in the SCC Jail on 2-23-17 also. jaf

ADDRESS INFO for Jason Alvin Markfort
Current: 554 Derrick Drive, New Richmond, WI 54017 United States  (Effective: 02-13-2017)
Prior: 1254 Blue Jay Place, New Richmond, WI 54017 
Per DE's 16CT53 case. jaf
PER JUDGE'S ORDER AT HEARING ON 2-03-17.  DE to pay $50/mo comm 5-15-17 (Feb - Apr pymts deferred).  PPF waived.  DE will be mailed an updated Order for Pymt.  Includes 13CT319, 15CM212, 16CT53. jaf
Final notice sent, due 1-26-17. cah

DE called to state that he is being sentenced today & will likely be serving a sentence & would like to have his Pplan deferred until he gets out.  DE was advised that I will speak to the Clerk to possibly meet w/him before he is brought down or the DE should let his Atty know so he can address it w/the Judge today. jaf

**Spoke w/DE after court today.  DE was not sentenced and will make Jan pymt as planned.  Will address the Pplan after sentencing in Feb.  jaf
c: Def, DA & NRPD. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley. Jason Alvin Markfort pro se.  Case called at 4:33 p.m. ADA McKinley states there is an agreement and gives the recommendations. State has complied with victims rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 WITHOUT the domestic abuse inhancer in 15CM212. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct without the domestic abuse inhancer in 15CM212. Defendant makes statement.   Crt orders:

- $250.00 fine. No DNA surcharge ordered. Set up a payment plan.

Spoke w/DE after court.  DE requested to have 15CM212 added to his current PPA.  DE to resume PPA of $50/mo comm 9-15-15.  PPF waived.  DE stated he did not need a new notice sent to him - will follow the PPA he previously signed.  Includes 13CT319, 15CM212. jaf
Pre-trial conference at 08-25-2015 04:15 pm

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley. Jason Alvin Markfort pro se. Case called at 3:58 p.m. Court reviews file. Defendant states he has not retained an attorney. Received an offer from the state. Court recesses at 3:59 p.m. for parties to speak. Case recalled at 4:05 p.m. ADA McKinley states they spoke regarding resolutions and Mr. Markfort would like to speak with an attorney. Court at that time will either set for a plea or trial. Address confirmed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle .ADA:  Francis D. Collins. Jason Alvin Markfort pro se. Case called at 4:21 p.m. Court does advise defendant of his right to obtain an attorney. Defendant understands. Defendant does not wish to apply for court appointed attorney. Court would like to set out to July to give defendant time to look into retaining an attorney. Address confirmed. Bond continues in form and amount. hml  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
to Jason Markfort ck# 024655 sent this date. eif
From Def. Re: Bond on file. Informed him request will go to the Bookkeeper today. km
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2015 at 04:15 pm.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Becky M.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: CAR, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski for today only,  DF:  Jason Alvin Markfort appeared.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Refund bond to payor.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
Jason Markfort  15R 004614. eif
